title: Aims
text:
Increased visibility of the breadth, depth and diversity of environmental and ecological academic statistics in Scotland
Increased engagement, impact and support for policy decisions (joint co-creation between statistical researchers and policy-makers)
Shared training for PhD students and delivery of high quality specialised training courses
Formal links for research collaboration and training between academic and non-academic institutions
An active research network in statistical methodology for environmental and ecological statistics across sectors

title: About
text: The Scottish Statistical Environmental and Ecological informal network has been formed to bring together several Scottish academic statistics groups to share expertise, form new collaborations, and link with external partners across industry and policy makers.

title: Scottish Statistical Environmental and Ecological Network (SSEEN)
text:
The Universities of Edinburgh, Glasgow and St Andrews have substantial complementary expertise across environmental and ecological statistics, both within Statistics groups and throughout other academic disciplines across each campus. Additionally, each group has strong relationships with a number of external (to the HEI) partners across a variety of application domains. All groups have a strong focus and interest in developing methodology leading to longer-term impact across policy, business and industry.
The Scottish Statistical Environmental and Ecological informal network has been formed to bring together these groups to share expertise, form new collaborations, and link with external partners across industry and policy makers.
